sub_tasks.requirements: Calculates patient age at admission using `p.anchor_age + EXTRACT(YEAR FROM fs.admittime) - p.anchor_year` and filters for the range `BETWEEN 77 AND 87`.
Identifies patients with an asthma exacerbation diagnosis using a subquery on `diagnoses_icd` with ICD-9 code `LIKE '493%2'` or ICD-10 code `LIKE 'J45%1'`.
Selects only the first ICU stay for each hospital admission using `ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY a.hadm_id ORDER BY i.intime)` and filtering for `rn = 1`.
Correctly joins `admissions` and `icustays` tables on `hadm_id` to link ICU stays to hospital admissions.
Correctly joins the `patients` table on `subject_id` to access demographic data like gender and anchor age.
Uses a `LEFT JOIN` to connect the `cohort` to `procedureevents` on `stay_id`, ensuring all patients are retained regardless of procedure status.
Restricts procedures to the first 72 hours of the ICU stay using `pe.starttime BETWEEN c.intime AND DATETIME_ADD(c.intime, INTERVAL 72 HOUR)`.
Calculates the procedure burden by counting unique procedures per stay using `COUNT(DISTINCT pe.itemid)`.
Calculates hospital length of stay in days using `DATETIME_DIFF(dischtime, admittime, HOUR) / 24.0`.
Stratifies patients into four quartiles based on their procedure count using `NTILE(4) OVER (ORDER BY procedure_count)`.
Groups the final results by `procedure_quartile` to calculate metrics for each stratum.

Correctly calculates the required outcome metrics: mean procedure count (`AVG(procedure_count)`), mean hospital LOS (`AVG(hospital_los_days)`), and hospital mortality percentage (`AVG(CAST(hospital_expire_flag AS FLOAT64)) * 100`).
